reviewText: Ahhh, DeathSpank!  The final game in the trilogy.  Like some action RPG's?  Like Diablo games?  This game is for you.  Absolutely fantastic dialog.  Funny stuff.  I've completed all 3 games and still wanting more.  Very fast paced and can be unforgiving at times with it's long range enemy projectiles, but damn worth it.  Come.. stay awhile.. and enjoy THE BACONING!
voteText: 17 of 19 people (89%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Being a fan of the first two deathspank games, I've always had an urge to purchase The Baconing when it came out on the xbox 360. After seeing many negative reviews on the game, i decided to hold off. Playing the game now on pc, i don't see what the whole fuss was about. This is the same tried and true deathspank formula packaged in a new adventure. The only concern was the difficulty of the game. I died many MANY more times in this game then i did in the first two combined. This game is a little bit more linear when it comes to paths to take, but this may be a positive or a negative to some. Game length was fair, seeing how this was a 15 dollar arcade game. I believe i beat the game in about 8 or 9 hours, and this is attempting every quest and collecting everything possible. If your a deathspank fan i would recommend this game to you in a heartbeat. Do not let the negative reviews sway you.
voteText: 12 of 14 people (86%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Dispenser of Justice, Vanquisher of Evil, and Hero to the Downtrodden, DeathSpank returns in this classic adventure to fight his sworn enemy, the Anti-Spank! The game embodies a variety of classic RPG elements, tons of loot and the same comedic touch as it predecesors. Tied together by the Hack'n'Slash approach, The Baconing is a must play for all RPG enthusiasts and DeathSpank followers.

+ Funny storyline
+ Funny take on protagonist
+ Classic RPG elements
+ Tons of loot and a multitude of equipment combos/sets
+ Touches a variety of topics like corruption, gambling, nuclear sex
+ Easy Achievements
+ Local Co-Op
- No Trading Cards (Emotes/Backgrounds)


Personal Ranking: 7.5
voteText: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A very fun and sattire saturated game. This is basically a mix between a hack&slash and adventure game (not point&click, rather Rayman type).

The main point of this game is an absurd storyline that is too wacky to describe here. Go and play it, you won't be disappointed if you like Monty Python like humor.

Pros:
- very nice gameplay, I just wanted to complete this game to see how it ends
- parodies many tropes, movies and games
- graphics are cartoony which supports the overall tone of the game

Cons:
- it gets too easy to early - basically you have loads of bombs, medkits or other support items that you can use anytime
- some riddles are just too wacky
- later in the game there is one stage with lots of backtracking - fortunately it's not too long

I really recommend this game, it's fast, it's fun and you can have a good laugh when playing it.

One hint - don't buy DLC if you just play singleplayer, because it's just a different character for the second player and that's all it is in this Roesha DLC.

reviewText: Alrighty. I'm a big fan of those Diablo 2 type games., which the Baconing is. The humour of this game, with the dialogue all being hilariously fully voiced by talented vocal actors is a real joy. It's a heavy dose of parody, with a good dash of genuine wit. The second wonderful thing about this game is the art. I'm not one to get gushy about art, but the quality and the variety is really stunning.\n\nThe cons are this though; The gameplay, specifically the difficulty (through awkwardness/poor design choices) , does not match the game style. I can see Futurama watchers firing up this game, perhaps after taking a long pull on a ...cigar. This will not go well for them: the combat is brutal. Ranged attackers can brutally kill you from off screen in less than two seconds with their homing bulets, which to withstand requires shielding the *instant* the projectile would hit. Melee combat is not helped with click to move. Get this only on sale.

Unfortunately this time out they have introduced grinding for some reason.  Monsters go from being a good fight to killing you repeatedly until you can get decent equipment to face them with.  Another problem is the fact that other monsters will be shooting" you from offscreen
date: causing massive damage plus slowing you
recommended: PLUS causing damage over time with poison.  It just completely wrecks any enjoyment that you could have playing.  A disappointment all the way around.  Unless they can bring back the entertainment value of the first game
hoursPlayed: I hope to never see Deathspank again."

reviewText:
The Baconing is a sequel to DeathSpank. It's a cartoony, colorful action adventure game with gruesome humor. Fart jokes agogo as Deathspank fights an army of undead cyborgs to destroy some sacred thongs.

It's absurd, it's ridiculous. It's also colorful and fun and reminds me of some fo the more twisted cartoons of my youth like Ren and Stimpy, Invader Zim and The Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy.

The Baconing is a pretty simple game at its core, but has more complex equipment and item systems than what I was expecting. On the one hand it's kind of a button masher, but some fo the mechanics are overly complex for such a game.

It might be your thing if you like hack and slash adventures with sophmoric toilet humor, but it just didn't do it for me.

reviewText: This game attempts to follow up the prequels of Deathspank and Thongs of Virtue in the same spirit. The gameplay lacks here, since enemies often use ranged attacks out of frame to kill you. Where two two earlier games allowed the story-telling to be in focus and the dialogue options felt more interesting than just progressing The Baconing fails. However, it is still good for a few chuckles and while I loathe when achievements are tacked on for playing games on the hardest difficulty I can still say it's worth a playthrough. Fans of the earlier games may be somewhat disappointed, though.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The Baconing is a RPG-ish and hack'n'slash-y adventure game with hilariously stupid and funny dialogues, revolving around the justice-loving hero DeathSpank.

In typical RPG-manner you acquire main- and side-quests as you fight your way through the varying and - thanks to the graphical art style of the game -really good looking areas of Spanktopia.

During the course of the game you constantly find new equipment in the form of weapons, armor, potions and gadgets to assist you in fighting hordes of mad turtles, dinosaurs, aliens, roboters and other enemies. The levelling system (up to level 20) also awards you with more health, damage or other perks upon reaching a new level.

The game can be played both alone and in local co-op (one player with keyboard and mouse, the other with a controller) and has a playtime of around 8-9 for a complete playthrough, probably a little less when playing in co-op.

Either way, I highly recommend The Baconing as it is great fun and well worth its money!

reviewText: Excellent dialog, story, and charming graphics make up for what can only be described as mediocre mechanics, it's a hack and slash that will frustrate the hell out of you with collection quests and side missions that add little to the overall game and serve only as a comedy tool. The co-op feature is not much to write home about, with a number of sidekicks available with a sort of reduced functionality, no gearing for sidekicks limits this a bit and minimizes loot fights. The game itself is rescued by its pacing and story and on the whole I would recommend it at a lower than usual price. not worth the £10 tag it puts forward.

reviewText:
The Baconing is an isometric action game with very minor RPG elements. The graphical style of the game is somewhat unique. Many background objects look like props in a play and the game overall has a bit of a cartoonish look. The world is a bit weird and it looks like you're moving on roller, because the land is always crooked.

The gameplay is very combat heavy, but the combat isn't that much fun. You die quite fast on the harder difficulties and you have to block a lot. You can also reflect projectiles the enemies shoot at you with the shield, but you have to time it right. You have 2 weapon sets and you can quickly switch between them anytime you want. Each weapon set has two weapons that you can choose yourself. I used the other weapon set for normal weapons and the other one for Justice weapons. Justice weapons have a powerful special attack, which can be used when you fill your Justice bar by hitting enemies and blocking at the right time. The game also has a local co-op so you can play with a friend. One player is always playing as Deathspank, but the other player can choose one character out of 4 (5 if you have the DLC).

The few RPG elements the game has consist of collecting gear and leveling up and then choosing a hero card that boosts damage, health or some other thing. The levels mainly enable you to wear better gear and that's pretty much it. The gear system is pretty stupid, because you almost always get a better gear set when you go to a new area and then the old gear set becomes useless. Same goes for weapons and few consumables.

The game has an economy system, which doesn't really make sense. You get money from enemies and also by grinding your useless items and the only thing worth buying with the money is more consumables, because the weapon vendor only sells you items you've previously had. I only had to buy a few potions during my playthrough, so I had lots of money that I had no use for.

The strongest part of the game and the reason I liked the game, despite all its problems, is the humor and dialogue. The characters are quite funny and a lot of the dialogue consists of silliness. There are lots of somewhat random moments as well like en. So if you like that kind of humor and don't mind the somewhat dull combat, I recommend playing the game. The combat isn't that bad, if you have a friend to play with.

reviewText:
The Baconing is a simple and short action RPG with a humorous setting and plot. The settings are mostly interesting and they change at a decent pace. Humour is derived from decently written dialoque as well as absurd enviroments, items and creatures. Main gameplay revolves around killing numerous amounts of baddies.

Though the visual aesthetic is generally appealing, the simple gameplay gets really repetitive quick. Unfortunately, same goes for the humour. RPG's are really good targets for parody, but it seems like the Baconing misses the point on occasion and when it hits the target, it doesn't quite have the right delivery. The voice acting of the main character gets really grating by the end, even though the game isn't that long.

On top of that, the Baconing was clearly made for a controller in mind. Though playing with mouse and keyboard is serviceable, it is occasionally clunky and can get annoying in big group fights.

reviewText:
TL;DR don't buy, it's broken

So I enjoyed the previous two DeathSpank games a lot and got The Baconing. And I regret it so much... Before being able to actually play I had to verify my game cache because it crashed on launch. After close to 1h I ended my first playing session and the next time I wanted to continue (weeks or even months later) ... same thing again, but this time, I had no internet connection, so I couldn't use the verify game cache fix. NICE!
Well today I wanted to play again (it's been months since I played last time), this time it actually worked - for 10 minutes. Then it crashed again. This game is a pain in the ***, it's totally broken and not enjoyable at all.
Not worth even worth 1€ as the developer doesn't care at all (multiple reviews stating that it doesn't work for them, no updates since... I don't know, there has never been an update after my purchase). IF it would work, it seems to be a nice game, if you liked the previous titles, but it doesn't so skip this.

reviewText:
TL;DR don't buy, it's broken

So I enjoyed the previous two DeathSpank games a lot and got The Baconing. And I regret it so much... Before being able to actually play I had to verify my game cache because it crashed on launch. After close to 1h I ended my first playing session and the next time I wanted to continue (weeks or even months later) ... same thing again, but this time, I had no internet connection, so I couldn't use the verify game cache fix. NICE!
Well today I wanted to play again (it's been months since I played last time), this time it actually worked - for 10 minutes. Then it crashed again. This game is a pain in the ***, it's totally broken and not enjoyable at all.
Not worth even worth 1€ as the developer doesn't care at all (multiple reviews stating that it doesn't work for them, no updates since... I don't know, there has never been an update after my purchase). IF it would work, it seems to be a nice game, if you liked the previous titles, but it doesn't so skip this.

reviewText: Picked this one up from Humble. I wouldn't say it's $15 good (stock price) but it definitely has its charm. a good 10+ hours of game play with all side quests.\n\nI greatly enjoyed the fact that you don't have to do a lot of extra grinding to move along in this game. There are too many games out there that pad the level barriers to make a few extra hours of boring play. as hack and slash games go it's decent... nothing to brag about, but definitely not a bad game.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I can't recommend this one. The story is ok in an over-the-top ridiculous kind of way, some of it is sort of funny. The RPG elements are super light, the loot system is very shallow to the point that you can essentially ignore it. After the first zone you realize that each zone is going to follow the same exact formula. Some quests have you running back through areas you already cleared, which at times can seem like an annoying way to extend the hours the game has to offer.

The worst part about this game is that the combat is extremely clumsy feeling. You must be quick and have timing down with your shield bash to win in the encounters, but the inputs feel laggy and you often miss the enemies for no good reason. Its the main part of the game, and it is implemented badly. This makes the game pretty challenging at times. Challenging is fine, but challenging because the controls are bad is not.

Overall, everything feels rushed. I had heard good things about this series, but this is not the one to get into.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I have nearly 500 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game.

One Hour Reviews - Game 20
The Baconing
Purchase Date: 10/17/2014

I picked up The Baconing as part of a Humble Bundle.  I didn't realize until after I had played that this is actually the 3rd of a series of games featuring DeathSpank.   Looking back I could see where the game was making reference to prior games, but at the same time it isn't strictly necessary to have played the other 2.

Gameplay reminded me of Diablo II, but simpler in nature.  Actually I think Torchlight would be the better comparison here.  There is a huge emphasis on combat, and you will be frequently swarmed with enemies.  Expect to die a lot.  I started playing on Normal difficulty, and even at that level I was dying really often.  In some ways it was kind of annoying because enemies would shoot ranged weapons at me from off the screen, while I'm also getting attacked at close quarters.  Fortunately dying has very little consequence in this game; it just zaps you back to your last checkpoint minus some cash.

I really liked the art style of the game.  Everything is cell shaded, which reminds me somewhat of Borderlands, but things are also drawn in this psuedo 2d style, like everything is a cardboard cutout.  When you look at things from the front they are drawn in, but as you get close and see from above everything looks like a cardboard cutout.  I'm not really doing it justice in the way I describe it, but it looks neat as you are running around.

I mentioned the gameplay being compared to Diablo II, not only because of the constant combat, but also the emphasis on loot.  As you win fights you are constantly picking up loot.  Rather than having to sell loot you can just use your 'grinder' to grind the items down for instant cash.  Also there is an option to auto-equip armor that is of higher level.  It definitely keeps you from having to spend too much time on inventory management.

Another interesting aspect is you'll come across fortune cookies which you can use in your quest log to get hints if you are stuck.  That said, the quests were really simple in the hour that I played.  Perhaps the game adds more puzzles in later, but I get the feeling they are keeping things intentionally simple.

I say this because DeathSpank is an idiot.  Playing DeathSpank reminded me of watching Inspector Gadget as a kid.  But that's really the whole point of the game, and it's what will make or break the game for you.  The game is full of humor all centered around what a complete doofus DeathSpank is.  DeathSpank is also voice acted, and I think they did a really good job here.  But if you like your games a little more serious or don't get into the bumbling idiot who still manages to win the day" kind of humor
date: then you won't really enjoy The Baconing.\n\nOne small complaint I have is the game did crash on me at one point after I clicked inside of my second monitor which caused the game to minimize.  When I tried to restore the game window it crashed.  I only had it happen the one time
recommended: but it makes me think this game may be not very alt-tab friendly.  Also

reviewText: The storyline to the Baconing IS funny. What isn't is the local co-op". Something that doesn't really appear on all those trailers touting the extra playable characters and sidekicks to the main character. What makes it worse is the amount of searching you have to do just to get a straight answer as to what EXACTLY "local co-op" means for a game whose amuzing storyline and colourful
date: action-packed gameplay makes it seem like the perfect game to play with a friend....\n\nWhat it means is
recommended: should you buy this game on Steam with plans for a co-op playthrough
hoursPlayed: your friend will either have to (somehow) share the keyboard with you OR (more likely) bring a console controller along to plug in.\n\nYes
voteText: that's right
helpfulPercent: after the fans of previous games clamouring for a better multiplayer option that could only have increased sales
votesHelpful: the company have allowed this game to become little more than another trouble port
votesTotal: while not making it clear from the get-go that one of the game's main selling points is severely limited.\n\nUnless you are looking for that info specifically while researching the game-- and even then --you will likely not realise this suspiciously brushed-under-the-table piece of info and will likely purchase the game before realising the issue. A shame really
votesFunny: since all it serves to do is remind PC gamers that the game is JUST a port
commentsCount: and harms future sales of what can easily be a fun experience
column16: as many gamers have and will continue to swear off any of the developer's future products.\n\nIn reality
column17: it only shows how that last little bit of effort to really make the game great was either too much effort for the developer or something they saw as not worth investing in
column18: for their customers. As I said
column19: a shame for a product that otherwise could have been easily recommendable."
